column4: i got that instructure from HOWTO in ubuntu: "3)the default gcc compiler needs to match the one used by the kernel (gcc-3.4 in my case)" so my question is: how do i know what gcc compiler i need to use if i am using kernel 2.6.12-10-386?
[4294667.296000]  Linux version 2.6.12-10-386 (buildd@terranova) (gcc version 3.4.5 20050809 (prerelease) (Ubuntu 3.4.4-6ubuntu8.1)) #1 Sat Mar 11 16:13:17 UTC 2006
what does this output need to give me?
so, it's abvious, your kernel was compiled with gcc 3.4.5
and the version of gcc you have installed can be retrieved with 'gcc --version'
so i don't need to download any other gcc?
or i need that one to compile whatever i need to compile with it?
if 'gcc --version' matches that metioned in 'dmesg | grep gcc', then yep, you won't need another one
is it okay or i need to downgrade?
i don't know what you're trying to do
if you need to build kernel module, than you'll either have to upgrade your kernel, or downgrade the compiler, or install alternative one
i am trying to install nvidia driver, and i am abit afraid, can you help me?
my nickname is not registered so hold on a second
